review.comment_positive: If youâ€™re debating which hotel to stay in Da Lat please look no further as youâ€™ll find nothing better than this place. Hien was incredibly welcoming from the moment we arrived. Although he doesnâ€™t speak English nor we speak Vietnamese, he was still keen to speak to us through translate to ensure we had the most amazing stay! He organised motorbike hire for us and even came with us to the petrol station as he wasnâ€™t sure whether we knew how to fill them up. On the night we arrived we were in desperate need of our laundry washing and it was given back to us on the same night which we were very grateful for. Our room was spotless and clean and was kept up with daily cleaning. The bed was so comfortable and we were extremely pleased that the TV had Netflix on especially for the day we got caught in a thunderstorm and spent a few hours hiding from the storm. The location of the hotel is perfect, situated only a short walk away from the night market. It is also far enough to not be bothered by the noise from outside. We loved Ves - Pa hotel and would recommend to anyone staying in the area. Thank you Hien for your kindness, we hope to stay again!

review.rating: Very clean, very friendly, chilled vibe in great area - we recommend you stay here!
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i CÃ³ Ban CÃ´ng
review.comment_positive:
Put simply: stay here! Our room was really clean and spacious, with a balcony overlooking the rooftops of Da Lat. Nice big bed and a TV with Netflix. The owner doesnâ€™t speak English but him and his wife are extremely friendly and enthusiastic and we easily communicated with them using Google Translate - and they made us feel very at home! The owner also stored our luggage for us when we left and got us a super cheap taxi to the airport which saved us a fairly substantial amount of money. They also rent out motorbikes (hence the name of the hotel!) 

Itâ€™s in a nice quiet backstreet but really close to lots of restaurants and bars and coffee shops, and the lakeside is a short walk (or v short taxi ride) away. 10/10 would stay there again if we ever come back to Da Lat.

The people are very kind and accommodating! Very nice. We arrived early in the morning (6am) and were able to check in to another room for a small fee so we could sleep. All very kind. Our room was on the four to floor and was surrounded by windows, giving amazing views of beautiful Da Lat! The fan was able to keep it cool enough. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. Fresh towels and bed made everyday! Water pressure good. Hosts do not speak much English but was not a problem thanks to Google translate, they were very nice.
review.comment_negative: Would have been extra nice to have drinking water available (instead of bottled water for a fee). Also was quite noisy until about 1am on a couple of nights due to dogs barking very loudly - probably louder for us due to the room we were in were all windows, so sound insulation maybe not as good as other rooms. Some ants in the room but nothing to worry about.

review.comment_positive: We were grateful for Mr. Hien's intensive support.
review.comment_negative: There were some noise from street wendors from down stairs started by 6:30am.  But it is difficult to find a completely quite place to stay in Vienam.  We checked in around 8:30 pm.  Mr. Hien asked us if we wanted to have dinner then he personally walked us to a near by restaurant .We rented a motorbike from the hotel to go out the next day.  He took my husband to fill up the gas tank in the motorbike.  We were lost on the way back.  Two minutes after we called he came by on his motorbike to lead us back to the hotel.  The day before we  checked out, he ordered a limousine van for us for the next day.  As we had to leave at 9am for a 4 hours ride he would buy us some food to go from the wendors for us earlier in that morning.  Thanks again Mr. Hien for taking such good care of us.

review.rating: Super helpful and friendly staff - An affordable gem in Da Lat!
review.comment_positive: The hospitality and friendliness of the owners was remarkable. They really made sure we had everything we needed, and proposed various services during our trip, such as renting a motor bike and fixing a taxi to the airport.  From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with a smile and the owner made sure to tell us about the hotel and show us around our rooms. It was clear that he knows how to make sure we were comfortable! The rooms were spacious and clean, the pictures definitely match the reality, which we have noticed was not always the case during our trip in Vietnam. At Vespa hotel, everything was perfect and the owners were just so friendly. Definitely a highlight of our trip and an affordable gem.

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i CÃ³ Ban CÃ´ng
review.comment_positive:
We are so glad with this accommodation choice! We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, got the possibility to do an early check-in and rent a scooter for 2 days at a very good price; the owner was very attentive and received us with a warm welcome. The room was big and very well cleaned (and completely cleaned again on the second day). The cost-benefit is incredibly good.
Recommend it 100%!

There were so many things that I liked about this place, so if you want to make your travel much more enjoyable, I think this hotel is an ideal place ğŸ¥°

Samengevat een heerlijke accomodatie met een heerlijk bed en goede douche en zeer klantgerichte eigenaren.

review.comment_positive: I don't even know where to start with this place. Maybe the owner: he doesn't speak any English, but with Google translate he could still help me with so much. He even spent half an hour helping me to rent a bike, driving me to the bike place with his scooter and making sure everything was OK. Him and his wife were so friendly, they made me feel right at home. Then the area of the hotel: it's central but quiet, full of cute little cafes and shops and still with an authentic local feel to it. The room was sparkling clean (sheets smelled yummy), had a fantastic view and a spacious bathroom. For all this, the price is really fair. I can warmly recommend this place to all travelers!

PhÃ²ng GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i CÃ³ Ban CÃ´ng
review.comment_positive:
We stayed in 2 rooms over 4 nights - one room was a 10star  other was an 8.

The hotel and owners are very friendly and helpful although no English, the hotel is very clean and the rooms were cleaned daily. The bed was one of the comfiest I have stayed in whilst travelling for one month in Asia and the bedding is very comfortable. The shower was also one of the best we have had while travelling. There is also lots of storage space which is helpful. 

The location is good, around 15mins walk to center and there is lots of food nearby. 

I would recommend this hotel!
review.comment_negative:
Really good stay just two things could have been improved:

The first room we stayed in (201) has two windows in it that face the corridor, the blind on the window was really useless and let in all the light from the corridor and its right above the bed, this meant the room was really bright all night if you do not have an eye mask.

On booking.com we booked a â€˜double room with a balconyâ€™, but only when they offered the room upgrade for our last two nights did we have a balcony. The second room we were in was really good, but I did not realise until now that we should have had a room with a balcony the entire time not just the last 2 days (the photos of the room i booked also show a balcony), i imagine the hotel might just need to update its booking.com listing

review.comment_positive:
Everything was perfect.
We arrived at 7am from the night bus and were supposed to check in at 12, but they let us stay in another room to rest until that time.
The owner was extremely nice and helpful. He showed us around when we asked for recommendations for places to eat, helped us park our bike every time he saw us arriving, and was always welcoming us with a smile. Although he didn't speak English, he managed to be pleasant and helpful as we communicated with a translating app.
The room was beautiful, comfortable and very clean, it was as good as some rooms in 4 star-hotels.
The location is excellent, right in the center, in a dynamic yet quiet part of the city.
I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.comment_positive:
After endleas hours looking onlne for somewhere to stay in Da Lat, we (a family of 4) decided to stay at Ves Pa Luxury Hotel and we are so glad we did. 
Hien and his lovely wife couldnt have done enough for us. From eating jackfruot seeds, hot sweet potatoes and drinling fresh coconut juice to helping us sort a local driver for the day we felt more like part of their famoly than tourists. The location is just of rhe main street but still close enough to walk to everything and nice and quiet at night. A small shop next dooe sold everything we needed and the locals were always happy to assist us anyway they could.....We arrived not knowing Hien and his wife but left as great friends. Already planning a tr
ip to stay here again next year.
